org.smtlib

Class CharSequenceReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smtlib.CharSequenceInfinite
      • org.smtlib.CharSequenceReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.CharSequence

    public class CharSequenceReader
extends CharSequenceInfinite
implements java.lang.CharSequence
    This class implements a CharSequence that obtains its characters from a Reader. The characters read are held in an internal char array, whose size grows as needed; it starts as initialSize and is expanded to currentSize*sizeMultiple + sizeIncrease whenever needed. The CharSequenceReader is an unconventional CharSequence in that its length() is not known; whether this will cause problems in some uses of the CharSequenceReader is unknown. The user should not use the value of length() directly; it seems to work in the ways it is called from Pattern.matcher.
    Author:
    David R. Cok

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected boolean readChars()
      Reads more characters into the buffer; may block until some are read; returns false if end of input has been reached, in which case no additional chars should have been read.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CharSequenceReader

        public CharSequenceReader(java.io.Reader rdr,
                  int initialSize,
                  int sizeIncrease,
                  double sizeMultiple)
        Constructor for a new instance
        Parameters:
        rdr - the Reader that supplies characters on demand
        initialSize - the beginning size of the internal char array
        sizeIncrease - the amount to add to the current size of the internal char array when the array needs expanding
        sizeMultiple - the factor by which to multiply the current size of the internal char array when it needs expanding

      • CharSequenceReader

        public CharSequenceReader(java.io.Reader rdr)

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • readChars

        protected boolean readChars()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: CharSequenceInfinite
        Reads more characters into the buffer; may block until some are read; returns false if end of input has been reached, in which case no additional chars should have been read. Does not expand the buffer, so the buffer must have extra space in it when readChars() is called.
        Specified by:
        readChars in class CharSequenceInfinite
        Returns:
        true if characters were read, false if no chars were read and end of input was reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
